title: Export Remix Compliance Blueprint
description: International and U.S. national export compliance codes and standards

un_cefact_edifact.name: UN/CEFACT / UN/EDIFACT
un_cefact_edifact.purpose: Message semantics (CUSCAR manifest, CUSDEC customs declaration)
un_cefact_edifact.reference: WCO Data Model data elements alignment

incoterms.name: Incoterms® (ICC 2020)
incoterms.purpose: Trade terms semantics (EXW, FOB, CIF, DDP)

international.cites: Protected species when commodities are listed

census_ftr.name: Census Bureau FTR (15 CFR Part 30)
census_ftr.purpose: AES/EEI filing requirements, data elements, USPPI, Routed Export Transactions, ITN handling

cbp_ace.name: CBP ACE / Electronic Export Manifest (EEM)
cbp_ace.purpose: Data elements by mode (Air, Ocean, Rail)

bis_ear.name: BIS EAR (15 CFR 730–774)
bis_ear.purpose: ECCN, license/exception checks (GBS, LVS, TSR), De Minimis/content rules

ofac.name: OFAC (31 CFR)
ofac.purpose: Sanctions programs; SDN, SSI, regional embargoes

requirements: USPPI (name + U.S. address + EIN) required unless Routed Export Transaction
ITN must be present when AES filing is required
If routed, store AES filer role
HS (6-digit) / Schedule B (10-digit) required for each line
If commodity likely dual-use → require ECCN or document reason NLR
If ECCN present, evaluate license exception fields (LVS/GBS/TSR)
If dangerous_goods present, require UN number, class, packing group
Proper shipping name in description for air/ocean
If wood packaging → require ISPM-15 declaration or flag warn
If Incoterm shifts cost/risk (e.g., DDP), require additional fields
